text: Alongside the @EnvAgency consultation, we are still accepting comments on the UK HPR1000 generic design, as part of the GDA comments process. We've summarised some of the common comment themes received so far - https://t.co/rn9vhqAahs https://t.co/nbVgV4ISpu

Don't miss the @UKCRP_SPF webinar tomorrow at 12pm GMT with Paul Sayers (Sayers & Partners), talking about simulating spatially coherent widespread flood events across the UK. Stakeholder response from @DrMSteel @EnvAgency.  Chaired by Prof Jason Lowe. 
👉https://t.co/Ak3QzxHwpt https://t.co/B40NU0Nq1n

text: @TheTiercel @JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice And these are just the ones I’ve found. I’m told the incident is under investigation by MCA. Whether they find the perpetrator(s) remains to be seen but whatever sanctions might be applied, it seems insignificant compared to the immeasurable cost to wildlife already struggling.
#Floodvulnerability and urban resilience: a real-time study of local recovery following the floods of June 2007 in #Hull https://t.co/aaP6jqfXAo @EnvAgency https://t.co/Sgh6fRzvxN

@MarkEdwards38 @JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice Two razorbills, shag, guillemot and a great northern diver. Tragic. My dislike of palm oil has just ratcheted up another notch.

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

text:
The @EnvAgency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from @TheENDSReport.
https://t.co/6vI9ZC2H8l
RT @TheENDSReport: One of the largest industrial installations in the UK had the worst possible permit compliance rating in 2019, according…

The Environment Agency (EA) was aware of 544 active illegal waste sites between March 2019 and March 2020, representing a 21% reduction on the previous year and the lowest number on record.

@EnvAgency https://t.co/hG1oQUaUyz

One of the largest industrial installations in the UK had the worst possible permit compliance rating in 2019, according to data released yesterday by the @EnvAgency 
https://t.co/fKspavbBJa
